page.title: 04PAST ECONOMIC ACTIVITY (2)
page.content:
Apart from tin mining the granite of Tregonning Hill has decomposed to form China Clay{(Kaolin).}Men from the village quarried this china clay from a large pit on the hill. The china clay was cut into cubes and transported down to the port of Porthleven.
The tin ore from the mines was sent firstly to Redruth and later to St Just in West Penwith. The tin stamps which crushed the ore in the mines worked all day and night and could be heard from the village.
Ashton was also the site of one of Helston's toll houses funding the town council.
